     </div>
    </header>
    <div id="et-main-area">
     <div id="main-content">
      <article class="post-241833 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-241833">
       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_pb_with_background et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_0">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_0 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h2>
                <strong>
                 Requirements
                </strong>
               </h2>
               <p>
                As a program of excellence, Neurasmus seeks candidates with a
                <strong>
                 strong academic foundation,
                </strong>
                dedication to neuroscience, and the skills necessary to succeed in an interdisciplinary environment. Applicants must demonstrate their ability to excel in
                <strong>
                 rigorous coursework
                </strong>
                and
                <strong>
                 research opportunities
                </strong>
                .
               </p>
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 Language Requirements
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                Since all courses are taught in English, a strong command of the language is essential. Applicants must provide proof of proficiency through recognized tests such as TOEFL, IELTS, or equivalent certifications. Exemptions may apply for native English speakers or those who have completed prior education in English.
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 IELTS (Academic Test): 6.5 (with no score below 6)
                </li>
                <li>
                 TOEFL: Paper-based 580 / Computer-based 237 / Internet-based 93
                </li>
                <li>
                 Certificate of Advanced English: B/C
                </li>
                <li>
                 Certificate of Proficiency in English: B/C
                </li>
               </ul>
               <p>
                The test must have been completed no more than two years before the course starts. Please note that Primary and Secondary Education certificates or 1-year exchange programme documentation are not accepted as English certificates.
               </p>
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 Educational Background
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                Candidates must hold a Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in natural sciences or a related field. This includes, but is not limited to, biology, chemistry, medicine, or psychology. A solid understanding of fundamental concepts in biology, chemistry, and mathematics is essential for success in the program.
               </p>
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 GPA Transcript & Grades
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                Applicants are required to submit their academic transcripts, showcasing a strong academic record. A minimum GPA equivalent to the program’s requirements is expected. Candidates should ensure their grades reflect proficiency in courses relevant to neuroscience.
               </p>
               <h2>
                <strong>
                 Steps to Apply
                </strong>
               </h2>
               <p>
                The application process for Neurasmus is streamlined yet thorough, ensuring the selection of highly motivated and capable students. Below is an overview of the steps to submit a successful application:
               </p>
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 Online Application Form
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                Begin your journey by completing the online application form. Ensure all required fields are filled out accurately, including personal details, educational background, and contact information. The form is your first opportunity to present yourself as a strong candidate, so be thorough and precise.
               </p>
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 List of Attachments
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                To finalize your application, you’ll need to provide the following documents:
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module dvmd_table_maker dvmd_table_maker_0 dvmd_tm_version_3_1_2">
              <div class="et_pb_module_inner">
               <div aria-colcount="3" aria-rowcount="6" class="dvmd_tm_table dvmd_preload" role="table">
                <div aria-rowindex="1" class="dvmd_tm_trow dvmd_tm_trow_0" role="row">
                 <div aria-colindex="1" aria-rowindex="1" class="dvmd_table_maker_item_0 dvmd_tm_tcell dvmd_tm_chead dvmd_tm_col_0 dvmd_tm_row_0 dvmd_tm_col_first dvmd_tm_row_first dvmd_tm_col_odd dvmd_tm_row_odd" role="columnheader">
                  <div class="dvmd_tm_cdata">
                   Document
                  </div>
                 </div>
                 <div aria-colindex="2" aria-rowindex="1" class="dvmd_table_maker_item_1 dvmd_tm_tcell dvmd_tm_chead dvmd_tm_col_1 dvmd_tm_row_0 dvmd_tm_row_first dvmd_tm_col_even dvmd_tm_row_odd" role="columnheader">
                  <div class="dvmd_tm_cdata">

         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <h1>
            <p>
             Key dates for admission
            </p>
           </h1>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <p>
            Timing is crucial when applying to a prestigious program like Neurasmus. To ensure a smooth and successful application process, it’s essential to be aware of the key dates and deadlines. Below, you’ll find all the information you need to
            <strong>
             prepare and submit your application on time
            </strong>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            The Neurasmus selection process is highly competitive and designed to identify the most motivated and talented candidates. With
            <strong>
             limited places available
            </strong>
            , adherence to deadlines and submission guidelines is critical.
           </p>
           <p>
            Plan ahead and take the first step toward joining this exceptional program in neuroscience.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_5 et_pb_column_2_tb_header et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child et_pb_column_empty">
        </div>

    </header>
    <div id="et-main-area">
     <div id="main-content">
      <article class="post-241874 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-241874">
       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_pb_with_background et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_0">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_0 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h2>
                <strong>
                 Student Application Call
                </strong>
               </h2>
               <p>
                Upon review and evaluation of your application by the selection committee, selected students will be contacted for an
                <strong>
                 interview mid-February
                </strong>
                .
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 Final results of the selection will be published in March
                </strong>
                .
               </p>
               <p>
                For any question, please contact our Helpdesk :
                <a href="mailto:neurasmus-application@u-bordeaux.fr">
                 neurasmus-application@u-bordeaux.fr
                </a>
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_blurb_content">
               <div class="et_pb_main_blurb_image">
                <span class="et_pb_image_wrap">
                 <span class="et-waypoint et_pb_animation_top et_pb_animation_top_tablet et_pb_animation_top_phone et-pb-icon">
                  
                 </span>
                </span>
               </div>
               <div class="et_pb_blurb_container">
                <h4 class="et_pb_module_header">
                 <span>
                  Next application call for 2025-2027 cohort (for self-funded students only) :
                 </span>
                </h4>
                <div class="et_pb_blurb_description">
                 <p>
                  <strong>
                   Open :
                  </strong>
                  September 02nd /
                  <strong>
                   Close :
                  </strong>
                  December 02nd 2024
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  All applications should be submitted through our online system and meet the given deadline(s). Paper applications or applications sent by electronic mail will not be taken into account.
                  <br/>
                  Any application submitted after those dates will be automatically rejected.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  <a class="button-primary button-secondary" href="https://emundus-neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/index.php" style="display:inline-block;" target="_blank">
                   Apply now
                  </a>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <p>
                The Neurasmus Selection is a fair competitive process. Due to the limited places available and the high number of applications, the Selection Committee has to be very selective. However, in case of non-selection and if you have grounds to believe that your application file, although complete, has not been processed through the selection procedure, you may ask for further details by writing directly to the Neurasmus Head Office:
                <a href="mailto:neurasmus@u-bordeaux.fr">
                 neurasmus@u-bordeaux.fr
                </a>
               </p>
               <h2>
                <strong>
                 Candidates with special needs
                </strong>
               </h2>
               <p>
                Candidates with special needs, i.e. who have serious health conditions and/or physical disabilities that should be taken into account, are invited to contact the Neurasmus Office by February 10th at the latest, once the Selection process is done.
               </p>
               <p>
                > They should notify their needs so the Neurasmus Consortium can adapt welcome facilities and teaching material in case their application is successful. Depending on the needs, additional financial support might be provided to insure the best mobility conditions. Please send necessary information to the Neurasmus Head Office :
                <a href="mailto:neurasmus@u-bordeaux.fr">
                 neurasmus@u-bordeaux.fr
                </a>
               </p>
               <h2>
                <strong>
                 Personal Data Use
                </strong>
               </h2>
               <p>
                The personal data of selected candidates/applicants (proposed for a scholarship/fellowship, put on the reserve list or enrolled on a self-paying basis) may be used for the purposes of evaluating the programs, efficiently manage the projects, and producing statistics. Data could be made available to the EACEA, the European Commission, the European External Action Service staff, as well as to other stakeholders of the Erasmus+ program, such as Erasmus+ National Agencies, National Erasmus+ Offices and the Erasmus Mundus Student and Alumni Association.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_1_3 et_pb_column_1 et_pb_sticky_module et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_1 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_blurb_content">
               <div class="et_pb_main_blurb_image">
                <span class="et_pb_image_wrap et_pb_only_image_mode_wrap">
                 <img alt="" class="et-waypoint et_pb_animation_top et_pb_animation_top_tablet et_pb_animation_top_phone wp-image-2735" decoding="async" height="120" src="https://www.neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/sidebar-program.png" width="120"/>
                </span>
               </div>
               <div class="et_pb_blurb_container">
                <h4 class="et_pb_module_header">
                 <span>
                  You want a program overview ?
                 </span>
                </h4>
                <div class="et_pb_blurb_description">
                 <p>
                  <a class="button-primary text-center" href="/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Neurasmus-2025-European-master-in-Neuroscience-v2.pdf" style="margin-top:10px; display:block;" target="_blank">
                   Download brochure
                  </a>
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_2 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_blurb_content">

         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <h1>
            <p>
             Scholarship: understanding tuition costs and financing options
            </p>
           </h1>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <p>
            The Neurasmus program is committed to academic excellence and accessibility. To support students in pursuing this prestigious Master’s degree, we provide clear information about
            <strong>
             tuition fees
            </strong>
            and offer guidance on
            <strong>
             financing options
            </strong>
            . Whether you are a self-funded candidate or seeking external grants, this page outlines the costs associated with the program and resources to help make your journey affordable and manageable.
           </p>
           <p>
            With tailored solutions and opportunities for international students, Neurasmus ensures that
            <strong>
             talented individuals from around the globe
            </strong>
            can access this exceptional education in neuroscience.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_5 et_pb_column_2_tb_header et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child et_pb_column_empty">
        </div>
       </div>

     <div id="main-content">
      <article class="post-2940 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-2940">
       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_0 et_pb_gutters2">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_0 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_blurb_content">
               <div class="et_pb_main_blurb_image">
                <span class="et_pb_image_wrap">
                 <span class="et-waypoint et_pb_animation_top et_pb_animation_top_tablet et_pb_animation_top_phone et-pb-icon">
                  
                 </span>
                </span>
               </div>
               <div class="et_pb_blurb_container">
                <h4 class="et_pb_module_header">
                 <span>
                  WARNING
                 </span>
                </h4>
                <div class="et_pb_blurb_description">
                 <p>
                  We are currently applying for further funding with the EACEA and we will inform you of our selection for available scholarships for the cohort 2026-2028
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_1 et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_1 inverse et_pb_equal_columns et_pb_gutters3">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_3_5 et_pb_column_1 et_animated et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h2>
                What do Neurasmus fees cover ?
               </h2>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <p>
                Tuition fees for the Neurasmus program are comprehensive and include a wide range of support and services to enhance the student experience.
               </p>
               <p>
                As a Neurasmus student, your tuition covers:
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 Access to the
                 <strong>
                  Neurasmus Welcome Days
                 </strong>
                 , ensuring a smooth transition into the program.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Full access to all Neurasmus
                 <strong>
                  courses and workshops
                 </strong>
                 , including those offered through the Main Study Track and Student Personal Training Plan.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Student services assistance
                 </strong>
                 at each partner university, following local regulations.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Use of partner university
                 <strong>
                  libraries
                 </strong>
                 and adherence to their policies.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Use of
                 <strong>
                  IT infrastructures
                 </strong>
                 , such as computer labs and online resources, in accordance with university rules.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Participation in
                 <strong>
                  extra-curricular activities
                 </strong>
                 organized by the Neurasmus program.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Comprehensive
                 <strong>
                  insurance coverage
                 </strong>
                 through APRIL International, provided during Welcome Days.
                </li>
               </ul>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_5 et_pb_column_2 et_animated et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_image et_pb_image_0">
              <span class="et_pb_image_wrap">
               <img alt="What fees cover" class="wp-image-242542" data-lazy-sizes="(min-width: 0px) and (max-width: 480px) 480px, (min-width: 481px) 561px, 100vw" data-lazy-src="https://www.neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/fees-and-scholarships-what-fees-cover.jpg" data-lazy-srcset="https://www.neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/fees-and-scholarships-what-fees-cover.jpg 561w, https://www.neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/fees-and-scholarships-what-fees-cover-480x440.jpg 480w" decoding="async" height="514" src="data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20561%20514'%3E%3C/svg%3E" title="fees-and-scholarships-what-fees-cover" width="561"/>

            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_1_2 et_pb_column_4 et_animated et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_2 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 Tuition fees
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 The tuition fees are standardized across all study tracks, ensuring transparency:
                </strong>
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  For Partner Country students:
                 </strong>
                 €4,500 per semester (€18,000 for the full two-year program).
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  For Program Country students:
                 </strong>
                 €2,250 per semester (€9,000 for the full two-year program).
                </li>
               </ul>
               <p>
                These fees are allocated to cover local tuition fees, program management, and the organization of events like the Summer Schools, Orientation Week, and Neurocomputational Workshops.
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                </strong>
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_3 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 Living and travel expenses:
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                Students are responsible for their own living and travel costs. As European cities can vary in cost of living, we encourage thorough research into the partner cities to plan a realistic budget. The Neurasmus program does not provide financial assistance for these expenses.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>

             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_5 et_pb_text_align_center et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <p>
                Taking the first step toward becoming a Neurasmate is simple with our clear and well-structured admission process. Below, you’ll find all the information you need to prepare your application and embark on this life-changing journey.
               </p>

              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h3>
                Applying as a self-funded candidate
               </h3>
               <p>
                Self-funded students must plan their finances carefully to cover tuition fees and additional costs such as housing, food, transportation, and personal expenses. The Neurasmus team recommends preparing a realistic budget to ensure a smooth academic journey.
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                </strong>
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_button_module_wrapper et_pb_button_0_wrapper et_pb_module">
              <a class="et_pb_button et_pb_button_0 button-primary et_pb_bg_layout_light" href="https://www.neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/student-life/living-in-the-country-of-study/">
               Learn more about the living costs
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_5 inverse et_pb_equal_columns et_pb_gutters3">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_3_5 et_pb_column_8 et_animated et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_7 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 External grants & financing
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                For candidates seeking financial support, there are numerous external grants and scholarships available locally, nationally, or internationally. While the Neurasmus Coordination Office does not directly manage these funding options, we encourage candidates to explore external resources to ease financial burdens.
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 <em>
                  Examples of External Grants:
                 </em>
                </strong>
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  National Programs:
                 </strong>
                 Many countries offer scholarships for students studying abroad.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  International Organizations:
                 </strong>
                 Consider applying to programs like Erasmus+, which provide funding for education mobility.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Local Support:
                 </strong>
                 Universities and regional organizations may offer tailored grants for eligible students.
                </li>
               </ul>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

                </h4>

                  <li>
                   Start early: Research funding opportunities well before application deadlines.
                  </li>

         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <h1>
            <p>
             Funding Your Neurasmus Journey : External Grants and Scholarships
            </p>
           </h1>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <p>
            While our upcoming application period is open for self-funded students, we encourage you to explore various external grants and scholarships to help finance your studies. Here’s a guide to help you get started :
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_5 et_pb_column_2_tb_header et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child et_pb_column_empty">
        </div>

    <div id="et-main-area">
     <div id="main-content">
      <article class="post-241930 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-241930">
       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_pb_with_background et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_0">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_0 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <div class="et_pb_row_inner et_pb_row_inner_0">
                <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_inner et_pb_column_inner_0 et-last-child">
                 <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
                  <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                   <h3>
                    1. National Scholarship Databases
                   </h3>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Your Home Country’s Government Website
                     </strong>
                     : Many governments offer scholarships specifically for students wishing to study abroad. Check your government’s official education or foreign affairs website for relevant opportunities. These sites often have dedicated sections for international study grants.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Destination Country’s Government or University Websites
                     </strong>
                     : Many countries and universities also provide scholarships for international students. Research the education ministry or specific universities in your destination country for potential funding opportunities.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <h3>
                    2. Global Scholarship Databases
                   </h3>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <a href="https://www.scholarshipportal.com/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                      Scholarship Portal
                     </a>
                     : A comprehensive database that allows you to search for scholarships by country, field of study, and degree level.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <a href="https://www.daad.de/en/studying-in-germany/scholarships/daad-scholarships/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                      DAAD
                     </a>
                     : The German Academic Exchange Service offers information on a wide range of funding opportunities for students looking to study in Germany and beyond.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <a href="https://www2.ed.gov/fund/grants-apply.html?src=ft" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                      Education USA
                     </a>
                     : Supported by the U.S. Department of State, this resource provides information on scholarships and grants available for studying in the United States.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <h3>
                    3. Field-Specific Grants
                   </h3>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Research Councils
                     </strong>
                     : For students in fields like science, technology, and engineering, national research councils often offer grants for studying and conducting research abroad. Look up research councils or funding bodies in your home country or destination country.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Professional Associations
                     </strong>
                     : Many professional organizations offer scholarships and grants tailored to students within their specific fields. Search for associations related to neuroscience, neurocomputation, or other relevant disciplines.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <h3>
                    4. University-Specific Grants
                   </h3>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      University Financial Aid Offices
                     </strong>
                     : Many universities have their own scholarships and grants specifically for international students. When applying to Neurasmus, be sure to reach out to the local partner universities before, to their financial aid offices to inquire about available funding.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <h3>
                    5. External Scholarship Providers
                   </h3>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <a href="https://us.fulbrightonline.org/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                      Fulbright Program
                     </a>
                     : A prestigious scholarship program offering opportunities for international exchange in a wide range of countries.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <a href="https://erasmus-plus.ec.europa.eu/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                      Erasmus+
                     </a>
                     : While primarily for EU students, Erasmus+ offers scholarships for studying, training, and internships abroad. Explore this option if you’re eligible.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <h3>
                    6. External Scholarship Providers
                   </h3>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Crowdfunding Platforms
                     </strong>
                     : Some students successfully use crowdfunding platforms like GoFundMe or Kickstarter to raise funds for their studies. These platforms allow you to share your story and garner support from a wide audience.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Education Loans
                     </strong>
                     : Many banks offer loans specifically designed for students studying abroad, often with favorable interest rates and repayment terms. Research education loan options in your home country.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <h3>
                    7. Tips for Researching and Applying
                   </h3>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Start Early
                     </strong>
                     : Begin your search for scholarships as soon as possible. Application deadlines can be months before the start of your program.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Apply to Multiple Scholarships
                     </strong>
                     : Increase your chances of receiving funding by applying to as many relevant scholarships as possible.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Write a Compelling Application
                     </strong>
                     : Tailor your application essays and personal statements to each scholarship, clearly articulating why you are an excellent candidate.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Track Deadlines
                     </strong>
                     : Keep a calendar or spreadsheet of all application deadlines to ensure you don’t miss out on opportunities.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <h2>
                    Need Program Information or Documentation ?
                   </h2>
                   <p>
                    While we can’t assist with researching or applying for grants, we can provide any necessary documentation and detailed information about the Neurasmus program to support your applications. If you need program-related documents or have specific questions, please reach out to us.
                   </p>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <h1>
            <p>
             Applying as self-funded candidate
            </p>
           </h1>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_5 et_pb_column_2_tb_header et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child et_pb_column_empty">
        </div>

    </header>
    <div id="et-main-area">
     <div id="main-content">
      <article class="post-332 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-332">
       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_pb_with_background et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_0">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_0 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <div class="et_pb_row_inner et_pb_row_inner_0">
                <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_inner et_pb_column_inner_0 et-last-child">
                 <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
                  <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                   <p>
                    The Neurasmus Program welcomes each year a max. number of 20 students. According to the number of scholarships delivered by the European Commission each year, a few places will be available under the Self-funding scheme.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    The next cohort (2025-2027) will be for self-funded students only.
                   </p>
                   <h3>
                    Application procedure for self-funded candidates
                   </h3>
                   <p>
                    The applications for self-funded students open on September, 02nd at 08h00 AM CET, and will close December 02nd at 10:00AM CET.
                    <br/>
                    If you’re interested, please follow the next steps :
                   </p>
                   <ol class="list">
                    <li>
                     Please submit the
                     <a href="https://emundus-neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/index.php" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                      application form
                     </a>
                     online.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     read carefully the eligibility criteria and information on provisional costs(see below)
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     fill in the Self-funded Candidate Declaration (available on the eMundus platform)
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     Finish your application directly on the platform
                    </li>
                   </ol>
                   <h3>
                    Eligibility criteria
                   </h3>
                   <p>
                    Candidates can apply under a self‐funding scheme, but :
                   </p>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     They understand that they
                     <strong>
                      will have to pay the Neurasmus participation costs
                     </strong>
                     and they can expect no financial assistance from the EMJMD Scholarship Program. Neurasmus participation costs do not cover any living or travel expense.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     In case of sponsorship or application to external scholarship Programs, self-funded candidates will be required to provide the Board of Education with a proof of Sponsorship sustainability or a proof of acceptation to any other scholarship before the Neurasmus Program starts.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <p>
                    A non‐scholarship holder may thus be offered a position in the Neurasmus Program, on the conditions that :
                   </p>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     He/she fulfil the Neurasmus
                     <a href="/admission/how-to-apply/">
                      admission criteria
                     </a>
                     ; Any submitted application under a self-funding scheme will be revised and debated by the Selection Committee, considering the academic selection criteria set for scholarship holders. The academic level of non-scholarship holders must match the level of the selected applicants who applied for a scholarship.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     His/her ranking among the candidates allows him/her to obtain a place in one Neurasmus partner university.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     He/she has adequate financial support –
                     <a href="/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/SFgeneralinfo2021.pdf">
                      information on provisional costs
                     </a>
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <h3>
                    <strong>
                     Costs & Fees
                     <br/>
                    </strong>
                   </h3>
                   <h4>
                    Participation costs:
                   </h4>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     Programme country candidates: 4 500€/year to be paid to the Neurasmus Coordination Office (total of 9 000€ for the two years)
                     <strong>
                     </strong>
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     Partner country candidates: 9 000€/year to be paid to the neurasmus Coordination Office (total of 18 000€ for the two years).
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <p>
                    These fees are then used to pay local tuition fees, management costs and also events costs for the programme (Summer Schools, Orientation Week, Neurocomputational Workshops).
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    It is possible for candidates to search for external grants and support, but these options must be explored individually,
                    <strong>
                     the Neurasmus Cooridnation Office cannot provide this information.
                    </strong>
                   </p>
                   <h4>
                    Living and travel expenses
                   </h4>
                   <p>
                    Candidates will be responsible for covering their living and travel expenses. As European cities can be quite costly to reside in, we encourage applicants to thoroughly research our partner cities before applying. Please note that the Neurasmus Master program does not provide financial assistance for living or travel expenses.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                   </p>
                  </div>

     <div id="main-content">
      <article class="post-626 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-626">
       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_pb_with_background et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_0">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_0 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_blurb_content">
               <div class="et_pb_main_blurb_image">
                <span class="et_pb_image_wrap">
                 <span class="et-waypoint et_pb_animation_top et_pb_animation_top_tablet et_pb_animation_top_phone et-pb-icon">
                  
                 </span>
                </span>
               </div>
               <div class="et_pb_blurb_container">
                <h4 class="et_pb_module_header">
                 <span>
                  NOT UP TO DATE
                 </span>
                </h4>
                <div class="et_pb_blurb_description">
                 <p>
                  We are currently applying for further funding, and will know if there will be available scholarships in August 2025 for the 2026-2028 cohort.
                 </p>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h3>
                Preliminary information about the 2024 Neurasmus scholarship is now available !
               </h3>
               <p>
                For the edition 2024-2026, Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees (EMJMD) scholarships are offered to
                <strong>
                 Partner country applicants (PaC)
                </strong>
                and to
                <strong>
                 Programme country applicants (PrC).
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p>
                Are you
                <a href="/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/PartnerProgrammeCountryList2020.pdf" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                 “PaC” or “PrC”
                </a>
                scholarship applicant?
               </p>
               <p>
                Students with a double nationality (of a Partner and of a Programme Country) must specify their nationality under which they submit their scholarship application.
               </p>
               <h3>
                Available scholarships: EMJMD Student scholarships
               </h3>
               <p>
                Scholarships are open to higher education students from all over the world.
               </p>
               <p>
                Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree scholarships will be offered to the most appropriate candidates according to:
                <strong>
                 the selection ranking
                </strong>
                AND
                <strong>
                 the nationality rules set by the European Agency.
                </strong>
               </p>
               <p class="alert">
                > Candidates should be fully aware of the financial costs of the programme, as at the time of the application there is
                <strong>
                 no guarantee
                </strong>
                that they will be awarded an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degree scholarship.
               </p>
               <h3>
                Eligibility criteria
               </h3>
               <p>
                Candidates can apply for an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees scholarship to the Erasmus + Key Action1 programme (EMJMD) of their choice but :
               </p>
               <ul class="list">
                <li>
                 Students who have already obtained an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees (EMJMD) scholarship or are former Erasmus Mundus Master/Doctoral Course scholarship holders are not eligible for an additional scholarship under the EMMC.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Students benefiting from an EMMC scholarship cannot benefit from another EU grant while pursuing their EMMC studies.
                </li>
                <li>
                 EMJMD student’s scholarships are awarded exclusively for a full-time enrolment in one of the course editions.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Nationality rule : no more than
                 <strong>
                  three
                 </strong>
                 of the students selected for an Erasmus Mundus Joint Master Degrees scholarship should have the same nationality.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Scholarship holders spending part of the EMJMD course in their country of residence are not entitled to benefit from the monthly subsistence allowance for this period.
                </li>
               </ul>
               <h3>
                Partner country EMJMD Student Scholarship
               </h3>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 Eligible candidate
                </strong>
                :
               </p>
               <p>
                Any third country candidate who is not listed in the Programme country category.
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 Amount
                </strong>
                :
               </p>
               <p>
                The amount of money awarded to Partner country EMJMD scholarship recipients will be:
               </p>
               <ul class="list">
                <li>
                 Monthly allowance:
                 <strong>
                  1,000€/month
                 </strong>
                </li>
                <li>
                 Contribution to travel:
                 <strong>
                  2,000€/year
                 </strong>
                 scholarship holder
                 <strong>
                  resident
                 </strong>
                 in a Partner Country whose location is situated at less than 4,000 km from Bordeaux, France OR
                 <strong>
                  3,000€/year
                 </strong>
                 scholarship holder resident in a Partner Country whose location is situated at more than 4,000 km from Bordeaux, France
                </li>
                <li>
                 Contribution to installation:
                 <strong>
                  1,000€/2-years
                 </strong>
                </li>
                <li>
                 In addition, the Scholarship includes a contribution to the EMJMD participation costs, i.e.
                 <strong>
                  4,500€/semester
                 </strong>
                 corresponding to the mandatory contribution to the NEURASMUS tuition fees and insurance coverage
                </li>
               </ul>
               <h3>
                Programme country EMJMD Student Scholarship
               </h3>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 Eligible candidate
                </strong>
                :
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 Students whose citizenship is one of the 28 EU Member States: Germany, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, Spain, Finland, France, Greece, Ireland, Slovakia, Slovenia, Italy, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Portugal, UK, Sweden, Bulgaria, Malta, Poland, Czech Republic, Cyprus, Estonia, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Romania, and Croatia.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Students whose citizenship is one of the following countries: Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Turkey, and Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia (FYRoM).
                </li>
                <li>
                 Students from Partner countries who are residents or have carried out their main activity (studies, training or work) for more than a total of 12 months over the last five years in any of the Programme countries specified above (the five-year reference period for this 12-months rule is calculated backwards as from the submission deadline of applying for the master).
                </li>
               </ul>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 Amount
                </strong>
                :
               </p>
               <p>
                The amount of money awarded to Programme country EMJMD scholarship recipients will be:
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 Monthly allowance:
                 <strong>
                  1,000€/month
                 </strong>
                </li>
                <li>
                 Contribution to travel and installation: – 1,000€/year scholarship holder resident in a Programme country,
                 <br/>
                 – 2,000€/year scholarship holder resident in a Partner Country whose location is situated at less than 4,000 km from Bordeaux, France OR 3,000€/year scholarship holder resident in a Partner Country whose location is situated at more than 4,000 km from Bordeaux, France.
                </li>
                <li>
                 In addition, the Scholarship includes a contribution to the EMJMD participation costs, i.e.
                 <strong>
                  2,250€/semester
                 </strong>
                 corresponding to the mandatory contribution to the NEURASMUS tuition fees and insurance coverage
                </li>
               </ul>
               <p>
                <em>
                 <strong>
                  Residence distance is calculated via the distance calculator
                 </strong>
                 .
                </em>
               </p>
               <p>
                <em>
                 Here you can find the
                 <a href="http://ec.europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/tools/distance_en.htm" rel="noopener" target="_blank">
                  EACEA tool distance
                 </a>
                 .
                </em>
               </p>
               <p>
                <em>
                 <strong>
                  Nota Bene
                 </strong>
                </em>
               </p>
               <p>
                The place of residence of the student candidate will be verify by the Neurasmus Consortium on the basis of the provision of the documents listed below:
               </p>
               <ul class="list">
                <li>
                 e.g. a residence certificate issued in accordance with the candidate’s municipality normal registration rules;
                </li>
                <li>
                 a certificate from the candidate’s place of work, study or training issued by the employer or institution in question.
                </li>
               </ul>
               <p>
                <em>
                 The supporting documents must have been issued within 12 months before the submission deadline for applying for an EMJMD student scholarship, i.e. the consortium’s official deadline for student selection.
                </em>
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

              <span class="dsm_breadcrumbs_crumb dsm_breadcrumbs_crumb_current" itemprop="name">
               Student Life
              </span>
              <meta content="2" itemprop="position"/>

         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <h1>
            <p>
             Student Life: Fully Embrace the Neurasmus Experience
            </p>
           </h1>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <p>
            Life as a Neurasmate goes beyond academics—it’s about
            <strong>
             embracing an enriching international experience
            </strong>
            , building lifelong connections, and thriving in a vibrant multicultural community. Neurasmus offers comprehensive support to its students, ensuring a seamless transition into their host countries and fostering a dynamic environment of intercultural exchange.
           </p>
           <p>
            From the first steps of enrollment to joining an active alumni network, Neurasmus provides the tools and resources you need to
            <strong>
             succeed both personally and professionally
            </strong>
            .
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_5 et_pb_column_2_tb_header et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child et_pb_column_empty">
        </div>
       </div>

     </div>

    <div id="et-main-area">
     <div id="main-content">
      <article class="post-241699 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-241699">
       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_0 et_pb_gutters2">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_0 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h2>
                <span style="font-weight: 300;">
                 Explore the
                </span>
                Neurasmus Experience
               </h2>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1 et_pb_text_align_center et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <p>
                The Neurasmus program is more than a Master’s degree—it’s a journey of discovery. As a student, you’ll live and study in multiple European cities, gaining exposure to diverse cultures and academic environments. This immersive experience helps you build a global perspective while connecting with peers, professors, and professionals from around the world.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_1 et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_1 inverse et_pb_equal_columns et_pb_gutters3">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_1_3 et_pb_column_1 et_animated et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">

              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 Preparing your mobility
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                Once you receive your Letter of Acceptance, you’ll begin preparing for your exciting adventure. This involves handling key logistical steps such as mobility arrangements, enrollment procedures, and planning your stay in your country of study. Resources are available to guide you through each stage, ensuring a smooth transition.
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>

             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_3 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 Neurasmus student and alumni association (NEURASA)
                </strong>
               </h3>
               The Neurasmus Students and Alumni Association (NEURASA) connects current students and graduates of the program, fostering both professional and personal growth. This vibrant community offers a platform for networking, mentorship, and collaboration in neuroscience. Visit the
               <a href="https://neurasa.wordpress.com" target="_blank">
                NEURASA website
               </a>
               to learn more.
              </div>

              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h3>
                <strong>
                 Erasmus Mundus Students and Alumni Association (EMA)
                </strong>
               </h3>
               <p>
                EMA is a global network supporting students and alumni of Erasmus Mundus programs. Established by the European Commission, EMA provides a space for members to share experiences, access resources, and participate in initiatives that enhance the Erasmus Mundus experience.
                <a href="http://www.em-a.eu" target="_blank">
                 Register with EMA here
                </a>
                .
               </p>
               <p>
                <strong>
                 <em>
                  Need Assistance?

                </strong>
                <br/>
                For any questions, our team is here to help:

              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h2>
                <span style="font-weight: 300;">
                 Applying as a
                </span>
                self-funded candidate
               </h2>
               <p>
                Enrolling in the Neurasmus program involves several key steps to ensure a smooth start to your studies:
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Administrative procedures:
                 </strong>
                 Complete essential tasks such as obtaining your visa, securing insurance, and finalizing documentation.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Arrival preparation:
                 </strong>
                 Access resources to help you plan your move and settle into your new country.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Student platforms:
                 </strong>
                 Gain access to digital tools and platforms to streamline your academic journey.
                </li>
               </ul>
               <p>
                <strong>
                </strong>
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_button_module_wrapper et_pb_button_0_wrapper et_pb_module">
              <a class="et_pb_button et_pb_button_0 button-primary et_pb_bg_layout_light" href="https://www.neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/student-life/enrollment/">
               Learn more about the enrollment process.
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>

             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_8 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <h2>
                <span style="font-weight: 300;">
                 Living in the
                </span>
                Country of Study
               </h2>
               <p>
                Living in a new country is a transformative experience. Neurasmus provides guidance to help you adapt and thrive in your host country:
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Accommodation Options:
                 </strong>
                 Find housing on campus, through private rentals, or via shared apartments.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Cultural Integration:
                 </strong>
                 Adjust to local customs, make connections in your new community, and embrace the unique culture of your host country.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Practical Advice:
                 </strong>
                 Get tips on banking, transportation, healthcare, and other essential aspects of daily life.
                </li>
               </ul>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div class="et_pb_button_module_wrapper et_pb_button_1_wrapper et_pb_module">
              <a class="et_pb_button et_pb_button_1 button-primary et_pb_bg_layout_light" href="https://www.neurasmus.u-bordeaux.fr/student-life/living-in-the-country-of-study/">
               Explore living in the country of study.
              </a>
             </div>
            </div>

                <span style="font-weight: 300;">
                 Community

               </h3>
               <p>
                The Neurasmus community extends far beyond the classroom.
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Dynamic Network:
                 </strong>
                 Join a global group of current students and alumni working together to advance neuroscience.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>
                  Inspiring Testimonials:
                 </strong>
                 Learn from the experiences of alumni who have made their mark in the field.
                </li>
                <li>
                 <strong>

                 </strong>
                 Take part in mentoring programs, professional events, and initiatives led by the alumni network.
                </li>

           <h1>
            <p>
             Students & Alumni: a thriving Neurasmus community
            </p>
           </h1>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <p>
            The Neurasmus community brings together ambitious students and inspiring alumni, all dedicated to advancing neuroscience. Explore current students by year, showcasing their cultural and academic diversity, and discover how they contribute to this
            <strong>
             vibrant community
            </strong>
            . Dive into alumni success stories that demonstrate the global impact of the Neurasmus program.
           </p>

         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <h1>
            <p>
             Enrollment Process
            </p>
           </h1>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <p>
            Enrolling in the Neurasmus program is a two-step process that ensures students are registered both at the Université de Bordeaux and at their subsequent partner universities. During the
            <strong>
             Neurasmus Welcome Days
            </strong>
            , held at the end of August in Bordeaux, all students complete their initial enrollment at the Université de Bordeaux. However, students must also handle local registration procedures at each partner university they study at throughout the program.
           </p>
           <p>
            These registrations may vary depending on the university, with some requiring annual and others biannual enrollments. Partner universities provide support to help students navigate these local processes and meet all necessary deadlines.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_5 et_pb_column_2_tb_header et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child et_pb_column_empty">
        </div>

      <article class="post-241919 page type-page status-publish hentry" id="post-241919">
       <div class="entry-content">
        <div class="et-l et-l--post">
         <div class="et_builder_inner_content et_pb_gutters3">
          <div class="et_pb_section et_pb_section_0 et_pb_with_background et_section_regular">
           <div class="et_pb_row et_pb_row_0">
            <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_3 et_pb_column_0 et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough">
             <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
              <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
               <div class="et_pb_row_inner et_pb_row_inner_0">
                <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_4_4 et_pb_column_inner et_pb_column_inner_0 et-last-child">
                 <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
                  <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
                   <h2>
                    <strong>
                     Joint Enrollment
                    </strong>
                   </h2>
                   <p>
                    The Neurasmus program begins with a compulsory
                    <strong>
                     introduction session in Bordeaux
                    </strong>
                    . This session is an essential part of the program and brings together students and representatives from all partner universities. It serves as a foundation for both academic and social engagement, introducing students to the program’s expectations, European academic practices, and ethical standards.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    During this session, students receive
                    <strong>
                     comprehensive practical support
                    </strong>
                    to help them prepare for their mobility and complete administrative requirements. The Neurasmus Office facilitates the following key steps:
                   </p>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Signature of the Student Agreement:
                     </strong>
                     This document outlines the contract between the student and the Neurasmus Consortium.
                     <span>
                      Download the Student Agreement Template for the Scholarship Funded Scheme / Self-Funded Scheme
                     </span>
                     .
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Opening of a French Bank Account:
                     </strong>
                     Essential for students receiving an Erasmus Mundus scholarship.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Payment Procedure for Self-Funded Students:
                     </strong>
                     Ensures participation costs are settled appropriately.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Insurance Scheme Application:
                     </strong>
                     All students are covered by the Erasmus Mundus Insurance Scheme 2 (EMIS 2), provided by Marsh Company, in line with European standards. Detailed information and insurance cards are distributed during the Welcome Days.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <p>
                    The Welcome Days are also an opportunity for students to get to know each other through
                    <strong>
                     social activities, fostering a sense of community
                    </strong>
                    from the very beginning of the program.
                   </p>
                   <h3>
                    <strong>
                     Second Enrollment
                    </strong>
                   </h3>
                   <p>
                    Following the initial registration in Bordeaux, students must complete
                    <strong>
                     local registration procedures at each of their partner universities
                    </strong>
                    . These registrations may differ depending on the university, with some requiring an annual process and others biannual.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    Students are responsible for completing these procedures independently but will receive support from the partner universities to meet local deadlines.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    <strong>
                     <em>
                      Important note on fees:
                     </em>
                    </strong>
                    <br/>
                    Neurasmus participation costs include all tuition fees. Students are not required to pay any additional fees at partner universities unless they choose specific services not included in the main registration.
                   </p>
                   <h3>
                    <strong>
                     Diploma Recognition : For Chinese Students only
                    </strong>
                   </h3>
                   <p>
                    Chinese students enrolling at a Dutch or German university as part of the Neurasmus program must obtain the following certifications:
                   </p>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      APS (Akademische Prüfstelle) Certificate
                     </strong>
                     for German universities.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     <strong>
                      Nuffic Certificate
                     </strong>
                     for Dutch universities.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <p>
                    These certificates verify the authenticity of the applicant’s documents and may include an assessment of English language proficiency (e.g., an interview or academic test). Once validated, the certificates confirm that the documents submitted are genuine.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    <strong>
                     Key Points:
                    </strong>
                   </p>
                   <ul>
                    <li>
                     Chinese nationals living outside of China must also apply for these certificates.
                    </li>
                    <li>
                     The requirement applies to all Chinese students staying in the Netherlands or Germany for more than three months.
                    </li>
                   </ul>
                   <p>
                    For further details on the enrollment process or specific requirements, contact your host university or the Neurasmus administrative office.
                   </p>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>

         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_0_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <h1>
            <p>
             Living in the country of study
            </p>
           </h1>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_1_tb_header et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light">
          <div class="et_pb_text_inner">
           <p>
            Preparing for life in your host country is an exciting part of the Neurasmus journey. To ensure a smooth transition, we encourage students to
            <strong>
             get in touch with their future hosting universities
            </strong>
            , access resources provided by International Offices, and connect with previous Neurasmus students through our Facebook group.
           </p>
           <p>
            Here is a comprehensive guide to help you navigate
            <strong>
             essential aspects of living
            </strong>
            in your host country, from accommodation to living costs.
           </p>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="et_pb_column et_pb_column_2_5 et_pb_column_2_tb_header et_pb_css_mix_blend_mode_passthrough et-last-child et_pb_column_empty">
        </div>
       </div>
